definition: (used for transliteration)/old variant of 謳|讴[ou1]
Europe/abbr. for 歐洲|欧洲[Ou1 zhou1]/surname Ou

sentences.english: EUROPEAN FOLK contains examples of the design of everyday textiles and costumes of rural Central and South-Eastern Europe.
sentences.chinese: 本書精選中歐和東南歐部的日常服飾設計實例。

sentences.english: Romania in the Balkans northeast of South-Eastern Europe.
sentences.chinese: 羅馬尼亞位於東南歐巴爾幹半島東北部。

sentences.english: In southern Europe the coverage is patchier.
sentences.chinese: 而在南歐，這些社會救助的覆蓋面是不完全的。

sentences.english: Bosnia and Herzegovina is a country in Southern Europe, and is going to join the European Union.
sentences.chinese: 波黑是東南歐的一個國家，即將加入歐盟。

sentences.english: Albania in the Balkans in South-Eastern Europe the West Bank.
sentences.chinese: 阿爾巴尼亞位於東南歐巴爾幹半島西岸。

sentences.english: China's policy is widely appreciated by countries in Southeast Europe.
sentences.chinese: 中國的這一政策得到了東南歐各國的普遍認同。

sentences.english: In the south the summers are warm with thin card those of southern Europe.
sentences.chinese: 在南部，明尼蘇達夏日是晴暖的，溫度與南歐一樣。

sentences.english: Oriental tobaccos are often grown in poorer soils in southern Europe and the Middle East.
sentences.chinese: 東方型菸草在南歐和中東貧瘠的土壤中廣爲種植。

sentences.english: Greece’s banking troubles are a threat to economies in south-east Europe.
sentences.chinese: 希臘的銀行業問題則是東南歐經濟體面臨的威脅。

sentences.english: You sometimes see oxen pulling carts in southern Europe.
sentences.chinese: 在南歐，你有時能看到牛拉車。

sentences.english: Sage is an aromatic plant in the lamiaceae family cultivated particularly in southern Europe.
sentences.chinese: 鼠尾草是一種脣形科芳香植物，尤其種植於南歐。

sentences.english: Common scops owl is found throughout Southern Europe, Central Asia and in some parts of North Africa.
sentences.chinese: 遍佈於南歐，中亞和北非的一些地區。

definition: see 五彩繽紛|五彩缤纷[wu3 cai3 bin1 fen1]
a hot tourist attraction/a tourist trap
a hundred flowers bloom (idiom); let the arts have free expression
in picturesque disorder (idiom); irregular arrangement with charming effect
mien/bearing/grace/amorous feelings/flirtatious expressions/local conditions and customs/wind force, direction etc
gold and jade in glorious splendor (idiom)/fig. a dazzling sight (e.g. royal palace)
